business.headline: RBI cuts repo rate again: 5 key takeaways you must knowSince February 2025, the RBI has slashed the repo rate by a full 100 basis points. With this sharp reduction, it believes there's now less room left to cut rates further to support growth. So, the RBI has changed its policy stance from "accommodative" to "neutral".

RBI slashes repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, third consecutive cutThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has reduced the repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, marking the third consecutive rate cut. This decision comes amid a sharp drop in retail inflation to 3.16% in April and strong economic growth of 7.4% in the January-March quarter. The move is expected to make loans cheaper, benefiting borrowers, especially home buyers. The RBI has also changed its stance from accommodative to neutral, indicating a data-driven approach moving forward.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why RBI's bumper rate cut has Dalal Street buzzingStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 731.61 points to 82,173.65, while the NSE Nifty rallied by 236.30 points to 24,987.20 as of 11:21 am.

RBI's bumper rate cut to lower home, auto loan EMIs: What it means for youThe decision was announced after RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra and the six-member Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) wrapped up their three-day review on Friday. This is the third consecutive rate cut, following back-to-back reductions earlier this year, including a 25-basis point cut in April.

RBI slashes key lending rate for 3rd consecutive time, brings it down to 5.5%The decision was announced after the central bank's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, concluded its three-day meeting that began on June 4.
Sensex down over 200 points, Nifty below 24,800; Tata Steel gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 197.18 points to 81,244.86, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 50.70 points to 24,700.20 as of 9:55 am.

Sensex and Nifty likely to rise on RBI rate cut hopesAnalysts predict a rate cut in RBI's MPC announcement. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,849.50 as of 8:30 am, indicating that Nifty50 will open above Thursday's close of 24,750.90.
Stocks to watch on June 6 as RBI rate cut anticipatedInvestors will have several stocks in focus as the Reserve Bank of India is expected to announce a rate cut, potentially boosting the market.

Tesla's worst day ever: $152 billion wiped out after Musk-Trump falloutTesla's market capitalisation fell below the $1 trillion mark and ended the day at $916 billion, its biggest single-day loss in value ever.

Tesla shares fall 14% as Musk-Trump feud rattles investorsTesla shares plunged 14% as the Elon Musk–Donald Trump bromance ended and their feud spilled into the open, wiping out $150 billion in market value and weighing on Wall Street despite optimism over tariff talks.

India could become third largest economy in the world this year: Borge BrendeIn an exclusive interview with India Today, World Economic Forum President and CEO Borge Brende talked about India's strong economic performance and projected it could become the world's third-largest economy this year.

Tariffs, wars, AI: WEF chief breaks down what's next for global economyFrom rising tariffs and geopolitical risks to AI-driven productivity leaps, WEF CEO Borge Brende reveals how resilience, innovation, and cautious optimism could shape the future of the global economy beyond 2025

entertainment.headline: Abhishek Bachchan nails Garmi hook step in Housefull 5 BTS, Big B reactsAbhishek Bachchan showed off his moves with Nora Fatehi's Garmi hook step in a fun 'Housefull 5' BTS video. Amitabh Bachchan watched the clip and reacted with amusement.

Housefull 5 X reviews: Fans call it entertaining yet illogical Bollywood masalaAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' has received positive reviews from fans on X, praising its comedy, star performances, and thrilling murder mystery twist. Audiences are eagerly waiting for the release of the second part to see how the story unfolds.

Virat Kohli's sister rubbishes speculations of rift between her and Anushka SharmaVirat Kohli's sister Bhawna Kohli has shut down speculations of any rift between her brother and Anushka Sharma. Bhawna set the record straight in a now-deleted post.

Tom Cruise sets Guinness World Record for parachute stunt in Mission Impossible 8Tom Cruise has been awarded a Guinness World Record for performing burning parachute jumps in 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning'. He jumped out of a helicopter 16 times with a flaming, fuel-soaked parachute with a 50-pound camera rig on his body.

Chiranjeevi, Sobhita-Naga Chaitanya, celebs at Akhil-Zainab's wedding festivitiesNagarjuna's younger son, Akhil Akkineni, is all set to get married to Zainab Ravdjee today, June 6, in Hyderabad. Ahead of the grand day, wedding festivities began at the Akkineni house with several celebs in attendance.

A Big Bold Beautiful Journey trailer: Margot-Colin revisit past in dreamy love storyThe trailer of 'A Big Bold Beautiful Journey' introduces a magical love story starring Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell as two strangers who travel through their past memories. Full of love, old memories, and emotions, the film promises a heart-touching and dreamy journey.

Shine Tom Chacko's father dies in car accident, actor, his mother severely injuredMalayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko has been admitted to hospital after a car accident in Tamil Nadu. His father, Sibi Chacko, aged 70, died on the spot.

Rana Daggubati reacts to viral video of him getting angry at paps | ExclusiveActor Rana Daggubati was caught on camera confronting paparazzi at Mumbai airport, sparking debate about celebrity privacy. In an exclusive chat with India Today, he expressed his discomfort with invasive filming and called for respectful content creation.

Akshay-Tiger's stylish bike entry goes viral, ahead of Housefull 5 release. WatchActors Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff made a grand entry on a bike at an event, leaving fans thrilled with their stylish appearance. The moment went viral just ahead of the release of 'Housefull 5', which is already generating massive buzz and strong advance bookings.

Ranbir Kapoor's new clean-shaven look sends Internet into frenzy. WatchActor Ranbir Kapoor's new clean-shaven and slim look is going viral, and he is looking different from his 'Animal' appearance. He also won hearts by being sweet to fans and paparazzi, ahead of his role as Lord Ram in 'Ramayana'.

Exclusive: Jackson Wang is finally coming to India on June 10; details insideGlobal pop icon Jackson Wang is all set to visit Mumbai on June 10 for a week-long promotional tour and cultural immersion. Read exclusive details.

Thug Life box office Day 1: Kamal Haasan's film fails to beat Indian 2, VikramDirector Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, opened at the box office on a solid note. However, the film failed to surpass the Day 1 collection of Haasan's previous films, 'Indian 2' and 'Vikram'.

Panchayat Season 4 to arrive early? Manju Devi vs Kranti Devi promo suggests soThe rivalry between Manju Devi and Kranti Devi takes a new twist in the rally cry song of 'Panchayat Season 4'. The video hints at the show releasing ahead of the July 2 launch date.

Ayushmann Khurrana's next with Sooraj Barjatya to go on floors in November: ReportAyushmann Khurrana will play the lead role of 'Prem' in Sooraj Barjatya's next family drama, which begins shooting in November 2025. The film, also starring Sharvari, is expected to release in the second half of 2026.

Farah Khan's cook Dilip shares chocolates with paps before first foreign trip. WatchFarah Khan's in-house cook Dilip is now a social media sensation. He was seen at the airport ahead of his first international trip.

Ranjeet shares birthday fun from Housefull 5 sets: Can't stop missing these momentsVeteran actor Ranjeet recently shared a throwback clip of his birthday celebrations from the sets of Housefull 5. Akshay Kumar, Riteish Deshmukh, Abhishek Bachchan, and others were seen celebrating with him.

Akshay Kumar wasn't the first choice for Jaanwar: Suneel DarshanFilmmaker Suneel Darshan revealed that Akshay Kumar was not the original lead for Jaanwar. The director had initially considered two other Bollywood actors before casting Akshay during a low point in his career.

Aamir Khan confirms superhero film with director Lokesh Kanagaraj. DetailsAamir Khan is set to work with Tamil director Lokesh Kanagaraj for his next superhero film. The actor confirmed the development and the film will go on the floors somewhere in the second half of 2026.

Ishaan Khatter addresses rift with The Royals makers over shirtless scenesActor Ishaan Khatter recently opened up about his rift with 'The Royals' makers over his shirtless scenes. Khatter said that he resisted certain scenes, however, they persisted.

general news.headline:
Live: PM's big Kashmir push weeks after Pahalgam attack, to open Chenab bridge shortlyPM Modi J&K Visit Live Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will today inaugurate the Chenab Railway Bridge, a record-setting structure that now stands as the tallest railway arch bridge in the world. Towering 359 metres above the Chenab River in Jammu and Kashmir, the bridge is taller than the Eiffel Tower and a key segment of the ambitious Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Rail Link (USBRL) project, aimed at bolstering connectivity in the region.

This will be PM Modi's first visit to Jammu and Kashmir after the deadly April 22 Pahalgam terror attack which killed 26 civilians, mostly terrorists. During his visit, PM Modi will also flag off two specially designed Vande Bharat trains connecting Srinagar with Katra. Stay with IndiaToday.in for live updates.

When unstoppable ego met immovable megalomaniac: Trump-Musk breakup in 4 ActsMusk bankrolled Trump's return to power, stood by him on election night, and was crowned a 'super genius' from the inaugural podium. But in just six months, Musk went from kingmaker to enemy number one — as ego clash led to a breakup that rocked Washington and Wall Street alike.

Murderers punishing police: BJP slams Congress over top cop's suspensionThe Karnataka BJP has accused the Congress government of targeting Bengaluru Commissioner B Dayanand and suspending him to deflect blame after the stadium stampede that killed eleven people.

RBI cuts repo rate again: 5 key takeaways you must knowSince February 2025, the RBI has slashed the repo rate by a full 100 basis points. With this sharp reduction, it believes there's now less room left to cut rates further to support growth. So, the RBI has changed its policy stance from "accommodative" to "neutral".

Operation Sindoor: United abroad, divided at homeWhen an all-party meeting is called to discuss Operation Sindoor, the prime minister doesn't even attend it. Now, when a special session is demanded on the post-Pahalgam situation, the government ignores the plea. When debate is strangulated, democracy is weakened.

This is the third consecutive rate cut, following back-to-back reductions earlier this year, including a 25-basis point cut in April.

Musk vs Trump: Will it affect Indian astronaut's launch to space?Elon Musk briefly threatened to decommission SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft after a public spat with Donald Trump over federal contracts, raising concerns over ISS missions and US-India space collaboration.

ED raids actor Dino Morea's residence in Maharashtra in River Mithi cleaning scamDino Morea had previously been questioned twice by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of the Mumbai Police, which initially registered the case.

Virat Kohli's sister rubbishes speculations of rift between her and Anushka SharmaVirat Kohli's sister Bhawna Kohli has shut down speculations of any rift between her brother and Anushka Sharma. Bhawna set the record straight in a now-deleted post.

How India beat Chinese tech used by Pak during conflict? Shashi Tharoor explainsSpeaking in Washington DC, Shashi Tharoor said India recalibrated its military strategy in real-time during Operation Sidoor to counter threats from Chinese-supplied systems used by Pakistan, including integrated radar and missile networks.

Not even in my dreams I thought I would lead India in Tests: Shubman GillShubman Gill claimed that he never dreamed about leading India one day in Tests ahead of heading to England ahead of the five-match Test series. Gill replaced Rohit Sharma as the captain of the Test team before the England tour.

PM Modi to unveil world's highest railway bridge over River Chenab shortly Live UpdatesPrime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Chenab Railway Bridge, the world's highest railway arch, and India's first cable-stayed rail bridge at Anji, completing a decades-long effort to connect the Kashmir Valley to the rest of the country by rail.

Why arbitrary-versary might be killing the romance in your relationshipRelationship experts believe that remembering an anniversary isn't strictly necessary. What is of more importance is genuine care, attention and understanding.

Musk says SpaceX to decommission Dragon spacecraft amid Trump feud, then a U-turnElon Musk announced SpaceX will retire its Dragon spacecraft after President Trump threatened to cut government contracts. The move follows Trump's public criticism of Musk and growing tensions over political differences, marking a sharp break between the former allies amid a heated feud.

RCB marketing head arrested, event firm officials detained over killer stampedeBengaluru police have arrested RCB marketing head Nikhil Sosale and detained three officials of event organising in connection with the stampede that killed 11 people. The action comes after the Karnataka government suspended top police officers amid criticism of mismanagement.

He jumped out of a helicopter 16 times with a flaming, fuel-soaked parachute with a 50-pound camera rig on his body.

Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta gets official residence after nearly 100 daysSources told India Today TV that Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has been allotted bungalows numbered 1/8 and 2/8 on Raj Niwas Marg, close to her assembly constituency.

Mediation implies equivalence between terrorists, victims: Shashi Tharoor in USShashi Tharoor firmly rejected any notion of equivalence between India and Pakistan, stating that there can be no mediation between terrorists and their victims.

RJ Mahvash reveals Chahal played through injury in IPL 2025: Had 3 fracturesRJ Mahvash revealed that Yuzvendra Chahal played through injury during the IPL 2025 season for Punjab Kings after their loss in the final to RCB. Chahal had missed three games during the season due to a wrist injury.

sports.headline: RJ Mahvash reveals Chahal played through injury in IPL 2025: Had 3 fracturesRJ Mahvash revealed that Yuzvendra Chahal played through injury during the IPL 2025 season for Punjab Kings after their loss in the final to RCB. Chahal had missed three games during the season due to a wrist injury.

Fan asks Rishabh Pant about Rohit Sharma, India star gives hilarious garden referenceIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant gave a hilarious answer when asked by a fan about Rohit Sharma's whereabouts at the airport. India left for England on Thursday, June 5.

Carlo Ancelotti's debut as Brazil coach ends in lacklustre draw against EcuadorCarlo Ancelotti's debut as the new Brazil coach was a lacklustre one as his side were held to a 0-0 draw by Ecuador in the World Cup qualifiers on Thursday, June 5. Argentina continued their fine run at the top of the standings with a 1-0 win over Chile.

I am always under pressure, even after winning Champions Trophy: Gautam GambhirIndian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir said that he is always under pressure irrespective of the results he's achieved with the team. Gambhir's next assignment will be the five-match Test series against England, set to begin from June 20.

Aryna Sabalenka hungry for maiden French Open title: 'It would mean the world'Aryna Sabalenka said that it would mean the world to her if she goes on to win the French Open 2025 title. Sabalenka has won all three of her Grand Slam titles on hard courts.

Gill replaced Rohit Sharma as the captain of the Test team before the England tour.

Kohli's Test retirement driven by mental fatigue, not poor form: Greg ChappellFormer Australia cricketer Greg Chappell has revealed the real reason behind Virat Kohli's Test retirement, saying that the star batter bid adieu to the longest format due to lack of clarity and not poor form.

New Zealand name former South Africa coach Rob Walter as Gary Stead replacementRob Walter has been named as the new New Zealand head coach of the men's national team after Gary Stead left after his 7-year tenure came to an end. Walter worked as the head coach of the South Africa team till April this year.

Shubman Gill will be reborn as Test batter at Virat Kohli's position: Deep DasguptaFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Deep Dasgupta has backed Shubman Gill to be reborn as a Test batter at Virat Kohli's batting position in the upcoming tour of England.

KL Rahul's red-ball return in focus in final unofficial Test vs England LionsKL Rahul will aim to make the most of his first red-ball game in months ahead of the Test series against England. India A will take on England Lions in the second and final unofficial Test starting in Northampton on Friday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
